intro: Blepharis dilatata var. explicator, commonly known as the broadleaf wireweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem, and it produces small, bead-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
